To indicate the risk to the fetus is required!
To explain how the risks are the least possible for achieving the objectives of the research is required!
To state who will determine the viability of a neonate and describe what procedures will be used to determine viability is required!
To describe preclinical studies and clinical studies, where scientifically appropriate, that provide data for assessing potential risks to neonates is required!
To indicate the viability of neonates to be involved in the research is required!
To indicate the risk to the neonate for neonates of uncertain viability is required!
To indicate vital functions of the neonate will not be artificially maintained is required!
To explain the research will not terminate the heartbeat or respiration of the neonate is required!
To explain there will be no added risk to the neonate resulting from the research is required!
To explain the purpose of the research is the development of important knowledge that cannot be obtained by other means is required!
To indicate the category(ies) that best describes the involvement of prisoners in the research is required!
To provide the name, type of facility and location of each local, state, or federal facility to be used is required!
To describe the possible advantages to participating prisoners is required!
To describe any additional steps that will be taken to avoid undue influence is required!
To explain how prisoners will be selected for the study and/or assigned to treatment groups is required!
To describe safeguards in place to provide assurances that parole boards will not take into account a prisoner's participation in the research when making decisions regarding parole is required!

To describe follow-up examinations or care of participants to be provided after their participation has ended, as applicable, taking into account the varying lengths of individual prisoners' sentences is required!
To indicate the category that best describes the research and provide the corresponding information is required!
To explain how the risk is justified by the anticipated benefit to the individual child is required!
To explain how the relation of the anticipated benefit to the risk is at least as favorable to the child as that which would be presented by available alternative approaches is required!
To explain how the risk represents a minor increase over minimal risk is required!
To describe how the study interventions or procedures are reasonably equivalent to actual or expected medical, dental, psychological, social or educational situations for the children is required!

To explain how the intervention or procedure is likely to yield generalizable knowledge about the child's disorder or condition that is of vital importance for the understanding or amelioration of the child's disorder or condition is required!
To indicate whether the parents or guardians will be present with the child during other discussions of the research or not is required!
To indicate whether sensitive or private information will be shared with the parents/guardians or not is required!
To explain the reason why sensitive or private information will be shared with the parents/guardians is required!
To indicate whether there is a possibility that any of the research participants will be wards of the State or any other agency or institution is required!
To indicate which language(s) other than English this study will use is required!
To list any investigator(s) and/or key personnel who are fluent in the language(s) of the participants is required!
To describe the provisions in place to provide interpretive services during the participant recruitment and consent processes is required!
To describe the provisions in place to provide translation services throughout the participants' duration in the study is required!
To describe the provisions in place to handle emergency contacts from non-English speaking participants is required!
To describe the expected range of participant impairment is required!
To indicate whether assent will be obtained is required!
To describe the process for ensuring ongoing consent if capacity is expected to fluctuate during research participation is required!
To select the one category that best describes the research and provide the corresponding information is required!
To explain how anticipated benefits, compared to risks, are as favorable as the alternatives is required!
To explain how the risk presents only a minor increase over minimal risk is required!
To describe the international sites(s). Provide location, name of local contact or investigator, and local contact information, as applicable is required!
To indicate whether there is an Ethics Board or IRB at the international site(s) is required!
To list contact information for the Board is required!
To describe any cultural, political, religious, or other local influences that may affect conduct of the proposed research and how these will be addressed is required!
To describe any local exceptions to the required consent process and how these will be addressed is required!
To explain any benefits to the local community that will remain with the community once the research is complete is required!

To describe the researchers' experience with conducting research (or studying or residing) in the research setting, including any relationship(s) with the community from which participants will be recruited is required!

To provide the name, title, and contact information (including email addresses) for two individuals who are not affiliated with the research who are knowledgeable about the location and population who could serve as a consultants(s) regarding the proposed research is required!
To describe communication and oversight plans between the researcher(s) who will be on-site and those at UAMS is required!
To describe procedures for the transfer of data between the local setting and UAMS is required!
To indicate if any planned research procedures are considered to be standard of care in the country or location is required!
